text:
Beverly Pepper (née Stoll; December 20, 1922 – February 5, 2020) was an American sculptor. She was known for her monumental works, site specific and land art. She remained independent from any particular art movement.
Pepper had her studio in Todi, Italy. She was represented by Marlborough Gallery, as well as Kayne Griffin Corcoran, who presented the first major Los Angeles solo exhibition of her work in 2017.
Pepper died on February 5, 2020, at her Todi home at the age of 97.
